PRASHANT SHRESTHA 
Email: mailpshrestha@gmail.com 
Phone: (972) 922-8474 
SUMMARY 
• 15+ years  of diverse experience  in risk  management, data  analytics and  visualization, strategy  development,  model 
implementation, application design  and  deployment in multiple lines of  businesses  including Fraud,  Debit  Card,  Credit 
Card, Home Mortgage and Treasury Management. 
• Extensive  experience  in  credit  risk  model  implementation,  monitoring,  maintenance  and  updates  to  the  models  in  the 
production environment. 
• Extensive experience in debit card fraud mitigation strategy development, pre and post implementation validation. 
• Experience in statistical techniques and concepts including Anova, Linear and Logistic regression, Decision Trees and 
Predictive Modeling. Developed fraud mitigation strategies and supported various modeling teams with data needs for 
credit risk model building, variable selection, data cleansing, back testing and model tracking.

credit risk model building, variable selection, data cleansing, back testing and model tracking.  
• Comprehensive skills in working with SAS BASE AND MACROS, SAS STAT, ODS including DOCUMENT, TEMPLATE, 
LAYOUT AND STATISTICAL GRAPHICS, SAS SQL, SAS ACCESS AND CONNECT in Unix and Windows. 
• In-depth knowledge of relational database structures. Extensive experience in coding SQL queries to access large-scale 
databases including Teradata, Oracle and SQL Server to support data driven analytics. 
• Designed and developed innovative, high-quality tools and solutions with focus on data driven structured programming, 
modularization, maintainability, user-friendliness and robust error handling techniques by integrating SAS programs and 
macros with UNIX shell scripts, various schedulers, version control and automation tools like Cron and Maestro.  
• Ability  to process  diverse  pieces  of  information,  create  actionable  insights  and  effectively  communicate  them  to all

• Ability  to process  diverse  pieces  of  information,  create  actionable  insights  and  effectively  communicate  them  to all 
levels, both technical and non-technical audiences. 
• Demonstrated ability to adapt, prioritize and learn quickly in a rapidly changing environment and deliver results efficiently 
and effectively under tight deadlines. 
 
EDUCATION   M.S. Electrical Engineering, B.S. Computer Engineering, Univ. of Bridgeport, CT 
CERTIFICATIONS       
• SAS Certified Statistical Business Analyst – Regression and Modeling  
• SAS Certified Advanced Programmer v9 & Base Programmer                                                         
 
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE 
Wells Fargo, Global Treasury Management (GTM) Fraud Prevention                                 May 2021 – Present 
SR. LEAD ANALYTICS CONSULTANT, Data Strategy and Optimization (DS&O) 
• Implemented multiple ACH and WIRES fraud detection strategies successfully in a SAS production environment, which

SR. LEAD ANALYTICS CONSULTANT, Data Strategy and Optimization (DS&O) 
• Implemented multiple ACH and WIRES fraud detection strategies successfully in a SAS production environment, which 
resulted in higher fraud detection with lower FPR. Worked closely with strategy owners with testing and deployment and 
developed various test routines to ensure correct strategy implementation. 
• Lead  and successfully  completed data migration project to use EPDH  as a primary  source  of  ACH  transactions for  all 
ACH fraud detection strategies, which enabled same day fraud alert generation and callouts by investigators. Performed 
extensive research and analysis of the data sources, population reconciliation, data quality and alerts comparison with 
the legacy processes. Improved recovery rate by over 8% due to a day earlier alerts generation. 
• Designed and automated a process to score ACH and WIRES transactions with an internal ILR model, which was used

• Designed and automated a process to score ACH and WIRES transactions with an internal ILR model, which was used 
in multiple fraud detection strategies and to prioritize alerts callout. 
• Maintained over 80 automated SAS  production  jobs  that  runs  on  a  daily  basis  and ensured all  processes  ran 
successfully as designed. Performed multiple highly effective enhancements to the production environment like creation 
of SAS macro  library, built testing  environment  within  a  code,  central  email  distribution  list,  error  detection  and 
notifications, which resulted in code streamlining, operational efficiency and reduction in error rates. 
• Extensively utilized complex SAS and SQL programming techniques to extract, parse, cleanse, transform and integrate 
relevant  information  efficiently  and  utilized  functionalities  like  Hash  Merge,  Arrays,  Iterative  Processing,  Dictionary

relevant  information  efficiently  and  utilized  functionalities  like  Hash  Merge,  Arrays,  Iterative  Processing,  Dictionary 
Tables, ODS including Layout, Template and Statistical Graphics, reporting procedures including Report and Tabulate, 
Tagsets like ExcelXP and Table Editor to build a complete and robust SAS based applications. 
• Maintained documentation for the production changes with focus on standardization of implementation and controls. 
 
Wells Fargo, CSBB, Fraud and Claims Management, NC                               Feb 2016 – May 2021 
ANALYTICS CONSULTANT, Detection Analytics – Debit Card Fraud 
• Developed and proposed fraud mitigation and detection strategies across all PIN channels with strong performance and 
high fraud detection rates while maintaining positive customer experience with over 98% transaction approval rates.  
• Designed  a  comprehensive  suite  of  new  automated  monitoring  and  early  warning  alert  capabilities including  insightful

• Designed  a  comprehensive  suite  of  new  automated  monitoring  and  early  warning  alert  capabilities including  insightful 
dashboard/data  visualization  in  SAS  and  TABLEAU,  which  provided  rapid  identification  of  fraudulent  trends,  data 
integrity issues, monitored strategy performance and various other key business metrics. 
• Proactively  reviewed  existing  MIS  reports  to  detect  and  evaluate the latest fraud  trends  and high-risk events, queried 
large transactional level database to identify root cause and analyzed the data to provide actionable recommendations. 
• Re-designed multiple time-consuming manual tasks to completely hands-free automated solutions, which ensured that 
processes  always completed  on  time,  eliminated  possibilities  of  human  errors  and  saved team  members  several  FTE 
hours that were dedicated to other higher priority projects.

2 of 2 
• Researched, analyzed and transformed multiple cross channel data including online banking, DDA, non-mon activities, 
geo location information, captured customer and terminal level profiles as User Defined Variables and utilized them as 
predictive decision elements to enhance strategies by lowering false positives and increasing fraud detection rates. 
• Partnered with Strategy Implementation, Fraud Operations and Debit Fraud Claims, shared current trends and assisted 
the teams with implementation and data analysis to ensure accurate execution of proposed strategies. 
• Led large dollar claim review meetings, which were very effective in identifying emerging fraud trends and gaps in the 
existing fraud detection strategies, resulting in development of multiple highly effective new detection rules. 
• Supported  Falcon  6  model  score upgrade  project  for  the  Debit  Card  PIN  portfolio. Performed  comprehensive

• Supported  Falcon  6  model  score upgrade  project  for  the  Debit  Card  PIN  portfolio. Performed  comprehensive 
comparison analysis of the new model score to the existing and provided recommendation across all PIN channels. 
 
Wells Fargo, Home Mortgage, IA                                                               Jan 2013 – Feb 2016 
CREDIT RISK ANALYTICS CONSULTANT, Real Estate Credit Modeling & Analytics 
• Involved  in  Data  Preparation  for  Sr. Lien  CCAR Models.  Provided time series  data  to  facilitate development of default 
(PD) and loss forecast (LGD) models used by various departments in the company. Extensive research and analysis of 
large-scale data sources, attributes, portfolio identification, reconciliation and various ad-hoc analysis to uncover trends 
and insights to support decision-making process. 
• Implemented new  versions  of  Credit  Risk  Models in  the  Horizon Production Framework.  Developed various SAS

and insights to support decision-making process. 
• Implemented new  versions  of  Credit  Risk  Models in  the  Horizon Production Framework.  Developed various SAS 
routines and reports to analyze, validate and ensure correct model implementation.  
• Applied innovative  thinking  and  creativity  to  identify  and  continually  improve  methods  to solve  and  answer  business 
problems quickly and  correctly.  Delivered  various  robust SAS based  analytical  tools  like back testing and  impact 
analysis  packages,  which  helped multiple  teams  assess model  performance and sensitivity analysis of  models to 
various factors including multiple economic and prepayment scenarios. 
• Developed automated reports to validate the corporate released economic scenarios that are used in Mid Cycle, Internal 
and FED Stress Test. 
 
Wells Fargo Consumer Credit Cards, IA                                                                   Feb 2011 – Jan 2013

and FED Stress Test. 
 
Wells Fargo Consumer Credit Cards, IA                                                                   Feb 2011 – Jan 2013 
RISK MANAGEMENT CONSULTANT, Fraud Risk Management 
• Designed and implemented an automated process to create reports that tracked and compared the approval and queue 
rates of  credit  card  transactions in  FDR  Falcon to  ensure  the  impact  of  new fraud mitigation rules are as  expected. 
Estimated time saving of 15 hours per month for each team member. 
• Analyzed  the  fraud  mitigation strategies requested  in  the  BRD,  translated  the  request  into  RSM  and  Falcon  language 
and implemented the rules in VDPS application. 
• Supported the launch of Visa Debit Processing System (VDPS), Risk Services Manager (RSM) and Falcon applications. 
• Developed various automated daily reports to monitor and alert VDPS system performance, data integrity, authorization

• Developed various automated daily reports to monitor and alert VDPS system performance, data integrity, authorization 
approval and queue rates issues during conversion. Reports provided rapid detection of system and data issues. 
 
Wells Fargo Home Mortgage, IA                                                                                   Oct 2009 – Jan 2011 
SAS PROGRAMMER, CONTRACT, Portfolio Credit Management, Risk Management. 
• Responsible   for Equifax   Credit   Bureau data   refresh   of   Legacy   Wachovia,   Wachovia   Construction   and   Wells 
Construction Loans on a quarterly basis, ensuring legal compliance by applying necessary exclusion rules. 
• Designed  an  effective process  to  obtain  FICO data  for HFI  (Held  for  Investment) and  HFS  (Held  for  Sale) loans  on  a 
monthly basis for model building and tracking, trending and static pool analysis.

monthly basis for model building and tracking, trending and static pool analysis.  
• Involved  in  data  integration  project  of  Wachovia  to  Wells  Fargo  data  warehouse.  Leveraged  existing  data  warehouse 
table structures and variable transformations to store new data, keeping it identical to the Wells data-mart. 
• Developed validation/reconciliation processes to demonstrate accurate data loads by creating various reports including 
distribution and time series percentile plots. Also documented processes and created necessary metadata. 
 
Discover Financial Services, IL                                                                                                          Jul 2007 – Apr 2009 
SAS PROGRAMMER, CONTRACT, Customer Credit Policy, Risk Management  
• Implemented several Credit  and  Cash  Line  Increases  (CLI)  and  Decreases  (CLD) risk  management strategies for

SAS PROGRAMMER, CONTRACT, Customer Credit Policy, Risk Management  
• Implemented several Credit  and  Cash  Line  Increases  (CLI)  and  Decreases  (CLD) risk  management strategies for 
various segments by applying necessary inclusion and exclusion rules and compiled final list for fulfillment. 
• Designed,  developed  and  maintained  an  automated  process  to  load  the  Discover  Personal  Loan  (DPL)  data  from 
FISERV into Teradata database on a daily basis and notified business users. 
 
Wellcare, FL                                                                                                                                                             Apr 2007 – Jun 2007 
SAS PROGRAMMER, CONTRACT, IT Core Systems 
• Designed and created Medicaid Claims Report for multiple states and provided it to the WellCare Operations. 
• Utilized existing macro library and developed new macros to incorporate the new business ad-hoc requests.

• Utilized existing macro library and developed new macros to incorporate the new business ad-hoc requests. 
 
Citi Cards, Citigroup, TX                                                                                 Aug 2005 – Feb 2007 
SAS PROGRAMMER, CONTRACT, Strategic Business Systems, Risk Management 
• Involved in the software development life cycle process including requirement gathering, analysis, design, development, 
testing and installation of the code in production environment to build and automate model-tracking reports.  
• Monitored,  supported  and  maintained  complex  applications  and  automated  processes  in  the  production  environment, 
which generated over 60 monthly reports, to ensure all systems are performing as expected.
